channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Prime ideals of Moh and the characteristic of the field
item.description: arXiv:2407.21692v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We reprove and generalize a result of Moh which bounds the minimal number of generators of an ideal in a power series ring in three variables over a field. As a consequence, we obtain minimal generating sets for the first prime of Moh, proving that the minimal number of generators might decrease depending on the field characteristic. This contradicts an statement of Sally. Finally, we show that these minimal generating sets are standard basis with the negative degree reverse lexicographic order.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gonz\'alez, Francesc Planas-Vilanova

item.title: The poset of normalized ideals of numerical semigroups with multiplicity three
item.description: arXiv:2407.21697v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the poset of normalized ideals of a numerical semigroup with multiplicity three. We show that this poset is always a lattice, and that two different numerical semigroups with multiplicity three have non-isomorphic posets of normalized ideals.
item.dc:creator: S. Bonzio, P. A. Garc\'ia-S\'anchez

item.title: An explicit upper bound for the HSL number of the top local cohomology module of affine semigroup rings
item.description: arXiv:2407.21731v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Hartshorne-Speiser-Lyubeznik number is a numerical invariant that can often be used to bound the Frobenius test exponent of positive characteristic rings. In this paper we look at positive characteristic semigroup rings generated by affine torsion-free abelian cancellative pointed semigroups that contain an identity, and compute an upper bound for the Hartshorne-Speiser-Lyubeznik number of their top local cohomology module at the maximal monomial ideal.
item.dc:creator: Havi Ellers

item.title: Galois theory of differential schemes
item.description: arXiv:2407.21147v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Since 1883, Picard-Vessiot theory had been developed as the Galois theory of differential field extensions associated to linear differential equations. Inspired by categorical Galois theory of Janelidze, and by using novel methods of precategorical descent applied to algebraic-geometric situations, we develop a Galois theory that applies to morphisms of differential schemes, and vastly generalises the linear Picard-Vessiot theory, as well as the strongly normal theory of Kolchin.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Toma\v{s}i\'c, Behrang Noohi

item.title: A Characterization of Quasi-homogeneous Bivariate Polynomials
item.description: arXiv:2403.05324v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: If a reduced bivariate polynomial is quasi-homogeneous, then its discriminant is a monomial. Over fields of characteristic $0$, we show that if one adds another simple condition, this becomes an equivalence. We also give a third equivalent condition that is stated geometrically.
item.dc:creator: David Bradley-Williams, Pablo Cubides Kovacsics, Immanuel Halupczok

item.title: $F$-purity and the $F$-pure threshold as invariants of linkage
item.description: arXiv:2406.05323v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The generic link of an unmixed radical ideal is radical (in fact, prime). We show that the squarefreeness of the initial ideal and $F$-purity are, however, not preserved along generic links. On the flip side, for several important cases in liaison theory, including generic height three Gorenstein ideals and the maximal minors of a generic matrix, we show that the squarefreeness of the initial ideal, $F$-purity, and the $F$-pure threshold are each preserved along generic links by identifying a property of such ideals which propagates along generic links. We use this property to establish the $F$-regularity of the generic links of such ideals. Finally, we study the $F$-pure threshold of the generic residual intersections of a complete intersection ideal and answer a related question of Kim--Miller--Niu.
item.dc:creator: Vaibhav Pandey

item.title: A linear variant of the nearly Gorenstein property
item.description:
arXiv:2407.05629v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The nearly Gorenstein property is a generalization of the Gorenstein property. In this paper, we introduce a new property $(
atural)$ that extends the nearly Gorenstein property in semi-standard graded rings. We show $(
atural)$ relates to a property in affine semigroup rings and generalizes results on Veronese subrings. Furthermore, $(
atural)$ and the nearly Gorenstein property are equivalent in Ehrhart rings of $(0,1)$-polytopes with the integer decomposition property and in rings with minimal multiplicity.
item.dc:creator: Sora Miyashita
